title: Examples
content: # Quick Examples This page demonstrates headings, links, code blocks, and an interactive Sandpack. ## Markdown features - Automatic headings anchors - GitHub-flavored Markdown tables | Feature | Status | |--------:|:------| | MDX | ✅ | | Search | ✅ | ## Code block ```ts export function hello(name: string) { return `Hello, ${name}!`; } ``` ## Sandpack preview <SandpackPreview />

title: FAQ
content: # FAQ **How do I add a new doc?** Create a `.md` or `.mdx` file under `src/content/docs/<version>/<locale>/`. **How do I enable code previews?** Use the `<SandpackPreview />` component in MDX files.

title: Getting Started
content: Welcome to DocuNext — a documentation platform built on Next.js. ## Features - Markdown/MDX content - i18n and versioning - shadcn-style UI components - Built-in search - Sandpack code previews ## Code Preview <SandpackPreview />

title: Installation
content: Install dependencies and start the dev server: ```bash npm install npm run dev ```

title: Overview
content: # Overview DocuNext is a documentation platform built on Next.js. It supports: - Markdown and MDX content - i18n via route segments - Versioned docs - Client-side search - Sandpack code previews

title: Examples
content: # Quick Examples This page demonstrates headings, links, code blocks, and an interactive Sandpack. ## Markdown features - Automatic headings anchors - GitHub-flavored Markdown tables | Feature | Status | |--------:|:------| | MDX | ✅ | | Search | ✅ | ## Code block ```ts export function hello(name: string) { return `Hello, ${name}!`; } ``` ## Sandpack preview <SandpackPreview />

title: FAQ
content: # FAQ **How do I add a new doc?** Create a `.md` or `.mdx` file under `src/content/docs/`. **How do I enable code previews?** Use the `<SandpackPreview />` component in MDX files.
